intro: Zygophyllum arboreum, commonly known as the desert candle, is a shrub or small tree native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has adapted to harsh environments with its succulent leaves and deep root system, allowing it to store water efficiently. It plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife. Zygophyllum arboreum is also valued for its ornamental appeal in xeriscaping due to its hardy nature and unique appearance.
